meanings.definition: A permit from an authority to own or use something, do a particular thing, or carry on a trade.
meanings.sent1: She needed a licence to drive legally.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant displayed its health licence prominently.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his licence to chill was revoked after the party.
meanings.sent4: Her licence to dream was renewed with each sunrise.
meanings.sent5: The licence to explore the unknown was her greatest treasure.

meanings.definition: Freedom to behave as one wishes, especially in a way that results in excessive or unacceptable behavior.
meanings.sent1: The teenagers used their newfound licence to mischief.
meanings.sent2: With great power comes great licence, or so they say.
meanings.sent3: His licence to procrastinate often led to unfinished tasks.
meanings.sent4: The licence to rebel against norms was a double-edged sword.
meanings.sent5: She wielded her licence to disrupt with care and caution.
